column75: 'Ability_Description'

column1: 'VARCHAR(50) REFERENCES Classes(unique_id) ON UPDATE CASCADE ON DELETE CASCADE'
column75: 'TEXT'

column6: 'The assassin may recruit assassins as henchmen'
'The assassin may recruit thieves as henchmen'
'The assassin may recruit henchmen of any class'

column75: 'If an assassin gains surprise he or she may elect to assassinate the victim. The assassin need not roll to hit for an assassination attempt
column76: which is a special attack resulting in a chance to kill the victim instantly and ensure damage even if the victim is not successfully killed. The percentage chance to kill a victim is 50%
column77: with a bonus of 5% per level of the assassin and a penalty of 5% for every two levels of the target (rounding down; in the case of monsters
column78: substitute “hit dice” for “level”). These numbers are approximate
column79: for the GM should modify the assassin’s chances slightly upward or downward according to the circumstances—guarded or wary targets are less likely to be killed
column80: and unwary victims are more likely to die. If the assassination attempt does not succeed
column81: the attack still inflicts normal damage
column82: together with any applicable bonuses. The assassin does not gain backstab multiple damage on a failed assassination attempt
column83: even if the assassination attempt was made from behind.'

column75: 'An assassin may backstab with any of the melee weapons permissible to the thief class. Backstabbing doubles the weapon’s damage at levels 1-4
column76: triple at levels 5-8
column79: an assassin attacks from behind with a bonus to hit of +4 rather than the ordinary +2.'

column75: 'Assassins are masters of disguise. Within reasonable limits
column76: an assassin can make him- or herself appear slightly shorter or considerably taller
column78: or of the opposite gender. An assassin can even disguise him- or herself as a member of another race (again
column79: within reason). Any person observing the disguised assassin has a base 2% chance to see through the disguise
column80: with one chance per day to do so. The base chance of seeing through a disguise increases another 2% if the assassin is posing as another class
column81: race or gender (max 8% chance). The GM may assign additional penalties and bonuses to this check if the observer is unusually wise or intelligent (or particularly stupid)

column75: 'Assassins are not inherently better at using poison than any other character class capable of using poison
column76: but generally have more opportunities to gain knowledge of poisons and their effects.'

column75: 'The assassin has thief abilities as a thief two levels below the assassin’s level. At first level
column76: the assassin has the thieving abilities of a first level thief
column77: but does not gain the abilities of a second level thief until reaching fourth level.'

column75: 'Ninth and higher-level assassins with Int 15+ may learn languages that it would be impossible for a non-assassin to learn. An assassin can learn an alignment tongue other than his or her own
column76: druids’ cant
column77: and thieves’ cant as additional languages
column78: but can only learn a maximum of four such special languages
column79: one for each point of intelligence above 14. Only one such language can be learned per level above eighth. Such languages are over and above any limits imposed by the assassin’s race and intelligence.'

column75: 'When an assassin reaches 12th level
column76: he or she has received sufficient training to cast spells from an arcane scroll (magic user or illusionist).'

column75: 'Clerics may memorise and cast clerical spells.'
'Clerics can “turn” the undead
column76: making them flee from the cleric’s holiness (or
column77: in the case of an evil cleric
column78: bringing them to heel as servants and minions).'

column75: 'These are awarded to clerics with high wisdom.'
'Druids may memorise and cast druidic spells.'
'All druids speak a secret language called the druids’'' cant.'
'All druids gain a saving throw bonus of +2 against fire and lightning attacks of all kinds.'
'At third level and higher
column76: a druid can identify plant and animal types
column77: and can determine when water is pure and safe to drink.'

column75: 'At third level and higher
column76: a druid can move through any natural undergrowth leaving no trace of his or her passage
column77: and may do so with no reduction in his or her normal movement speed.'

column75: 'At seventh level and higher
column76: the druid becomes immune to charms and other such mental enchantments cast by fey creatures such as dryads

column75: 'Druids of 7th level or higher may change their forms up to three times per day. The form assumed must be a natural animal
column76: no smaller than a mouse
column77: and no larger than double the druid’s normal weight; in the process of shapeshifting
column78: the druid recovers 1d6 × 10 percent of any hit points he or she might have sustained as damage.'

column75: 'When the fighter is attacking creatures with less than a full hit die (i.e. less than 1d8 hit points)
column76: the fighter receives one attack for each of his or her levels of experience
column77: e.g. a 4th-level fighter attacking goblins would receive 4 attacks per round.'

column75: 'A fighter exercising multiple attacks departs from the normal initiative procedure. The fighter will automatically attack first in the round unless fighting an opponent with multiple attacks of its own (in which case initiative should be rolled as normal). The fighter’s second attack in any given melee round will come last in the sequence.'
'If weapon specialisation is in play
column76: fighters may take a second proficiency in the same weapon as the first
column77: granting them one extra attack every 2 rounds with the weapon (hence 3/2 attacks with a melee weapon at 1st level
column79: +1 to hit and +2 damage owing to their skill. Specialisation costs one proficiency “slot” for melee weapons and crossbows
column80: and two “slots” for missile weapons other than crossbows.'

column75: 'For melee weapons that are not polearms or two-handed swords
column76: a third weapon proficiency may be used to specialise further; this increases combat bonuses to +3 to hit and +3 damage with the weapon.'

column75: 'At 7th to 12th levels
column76: fighters attack thrice every two rounds (3/2 attacks). A partial additional attack (e.g. 3/2 attacks) means that the extra attack is taken on odd-numbered rounds in the combat sequence.'

column75: 'At 13th or higher levels they attack twice per round (2/1 attacks). A partial additional attack (e.g. 3/2 attacks) means that the extra attack is taken on odd-numbered rounds in the combat sequence.'
'Illusionists may memorise and cast phantasmal spells. A beginning illusionist character will know four spells. Two spells should be chosen by the player from the list of first level spells
column76: and the other two should be determined randomly from the list of first level spells. Illusionist spells are written in phantasmal script
column77: which can ordinarily only be deciphered by an illusionist. Illusionists do not employ (or require) the read magic spell.'

column75: 'Magic users may memorise and cast arcane spells. A beginning magic user character will know four spells. One of these will automatically be Read Magic. The second spell should be chosen by the player from the list of first level spells
column76: and the last two should be determined randomly from the list of first level spells.'

column75: 'Mages of 7th or higher level may create magical potions
column76: scribe arcane scrolls (of spells that he or she already knows) and recharge magical rods

column75: 'Magic users of 12th level or higher may attempt to create other magical items by means of the enchant an item spell.'
'Paladins can cure disease (as the clerical spell) by touch
column76: once per week.'

column75: 'A paladin may detect evil at any range up to 60 ft at will
column76: provided he or she concentrates on doing so.'

column75: 'A paladin radiates an aura within a 10 ft radius
column76: equivalent to the clerical spell protection from evil.'

column75: 'Once per day
column76: the paladin may heal 2 hit points/ level to any creature touched (e.g. a third level paladin would heal 6hp with this ability)'

column75: 'Paladins of third level and higher gain the ability to turn undead as a good aligned cleric does
column76: but as a cleric of two levels lower than the paladin’s level.'

column75: 'At fourth level
column76: the paladin may summon a special Paladin’s Warhorse
column77: a heavy warhorse with enhanced hit points
column78: intelligence and movement speed. Such a destrier may be called only once every ten years.'

column75: 'Paladins of 5th level or higher can Cure Disease twice per week.'
'Paladins gain additional attacks as fighters do
column76: but less swiftly. At 8th level a paladin gains an extra attack every other turn.'

column75: 'Paladins gain the ability to cast certain cleric spells at 9th level.'
'Paladins of 10th level or higher can Cure Disease thrice per week.'
' At 15th level a paladin has two attacks per turn.'
'Rangers are less likely to be surprised (only on a 1 on 1d6)
column76: and more likely to surprise others (1-3 on 1d6) than other character classes.'

column75: 'Rangers receive a bonus of +1 damage per ranger level against evil humanoid or giantish opponents (including such creatures as orcs
column76: goblins
column78: for example). This damage bonus applies only in hand-to-hand “melee” combat.'

column75: 'Rangers may track other creatures
column76: with a base 90% chance of success in rural settings and a base 65% chance in urban or dungeon settings.'

column75: 'Rangers gain additional attacks as fighters do
column76: but less swiftly. At 8th level a ranger gains an extra attack every other turn.'

column75: 'At eighth level
column76: rangers receive limited spell powers
column77: drawn from the Druid and Magic user spell lists.'

column75: 'Rangers of 10th level or higher receive a special body of followers.'
'Rangers of 10th level or higher may use crystal balls and other such devices that permit magical scrying.'
' At 15th level a ranger has two attacks per turn.'
'If the thief can approach his or her target unobserved and strike with a melee weapon
column76: the attack is made at +4 to hit. Damage from a backstab is doubled—or trebled if the thief is of 5th level or higher. Thieves of 9th level or higher do quadruple damage
column77: while those of 13th or greater level quintuple the number shown on the die. Damage modifiers (such as those pertaining to strength or magic) are not multiplied from a backstab.'

column75: 'Climbing represents a thief’s ability to scale sheer walls and surfaces
column76: cling to ceilings
column77: and perform other feats of climbing that would normally be impossible. Climbing checks must ordinarily be repeated for every ten ft of climbing.'

column75: 'This ability represents the thief’s minute visual inspection of a new area for tiny telltale signs that something of interest or danger may be concealed nearby. It requires a full turn (10 minutes) to accomplish.'
'Some shadow must be present for this ability to be used
column76: but if the check is successful the thief is effectively invisible until he makes an attack or moves from the shadows. The ability can also be used to blend in with a crowd of people rather than disappear into shadows.'

column75: 'Use of this skill allows the thief to move with preternatural silence even over surfaces such as squeaky floors.'
'Opening locks and disarming traps (without springing them) is a skill unique to thieves
column76: which cannot be successfully attempted by members of other classes. A thief can also set traps (with the same chance as to disarm).'

column75: 'If the thief’s pick pockets check fails by 20% or more
column76: then his or her attempt has been discovered and the intended victim will almost always take hostile action.'

column75: 'The thief may attempt to read languages and ciphers of a non-magical nature only.'
'Thieves have their own language.'
'When a thief reaches 10th level
column76: he or she has become well-versed enough in training to cast spells from an arcane or phantasmal scroll (magic user or illusionist).'
